message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The condition described is consistent with fetal alcohol syndrome, which can be prevented by avoiding alcohol consumption during pregnancy. Phenytoin usage can cause fetal hydantoin syndrome, but the symptoms are different. Maternal toxoplasmosis can cause congenital toxoplasmosis, but the symptoms are also different. Maternal hypothyroidism can affect fetal brain development, but the symptoms would not be the same as fetal alcohol syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The physical examination findings and the baby's weight suggest fetal alcohol syndrome (FAS). Maternal alcohol consumption during pregnancy is a well-known risk factor for FAS. Phenytoin usage can cause fetal hydantoin syndrome, but the physical examination findings are different. Maternal toxoplasmosis can lead to congenital toxoplasmosis, which can cause a range of problems, but the physical examination findings are different. Maternal hypothyroidism can cause cretinism, which has different physical examination findings.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The infant is showing signs of Fetal Alcohol Syndrome (FAS) which can occur when a mother consumes alcohol during pregnancy. Maternal alcohol consumption is the best answer choice as the other options are less commonly associated with FAS. Proper identification and education of pregnant women regarding the risks associated with alcohol consumption during pregnancy can potentially prevent cases of FAS.
